item.title: ::alltome
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

LeScape Pk:

yar nova you’re so full of bullshit, I was the one who made the goddamned command and gave it to a few to many people, now everyone has it.

If I recall, I made the first tutorial on it.

This is just a little code I made to teleport all of the people on the server to one player. I made this sometime in August 2006. Here's the method and command you need. Created completely by me. Put this after any other method.

Purpose: Gather everyone.

Difficulty: 2 mana.

Assumed Knowledge: Copying.

Server Base: All compatible.

Classes Modified: Dont’cha know?

Procedure
Step 1: Copy

public void teleall()
{
	for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
	{
		if(p != null) 
		{
			client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null"))
			{
				person.teleportToX = absX;
				person.teleportToY = absY;
				person.heightLevel = heightLevel;
				person.sendMessage("Mass teleport to " + playerName);
				person.updateRequired = true;
				person.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
			}
		}
	}
}

This is the command, put this anywhere inside of customCommand.

if (command.startsWith("alltome") && playerRights >= 2) {
	teleall();
}

Now, if someone wanted all of the players on the server next to him, he would just type ::alltome. You can change the command name to anything else you like.

With playerRights >= 2, Gold Mods and the owner can use this command. If you want Silver Mods to be able to do this, change it to playerRights >= 1. If you want anyone to be able to do this, use playerRights >= 0.

Credits: Aftermath_96

I created that 9 months before you even joined the site.[br][size=1]Posted on: July 15, 2007, 12:50:40 PM[/size][hr]Here’s a cleaner version. That was ancient code right after I learned how to program in Java.

public void teleall() { for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { if (p == null) continue; client person = (client) p; person.teleportToX = absX; person.teleportToY = absY; person.heightLevel = heightLevel; person.sendMessage("Mass teleport to " + playerName); person.updateRequired = true; person.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Here’s my ::teleall command i made, use this void:

public void teleall() { for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { if(p != null) { client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null && person.playerName != "null")) { person.teleportToX = absX; person.teleportToY = absY; person.heightLevel = heightLevel; person.sendMessage("All have been tele'd to "+playerName+"!"); person.updateRequired = true; person.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } } }

item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Goneby123, post:15, topic:123522”]do i need 2 put anything to pub boolean proc?[br][size=1]Posted on: July 15, 2007, 12:07:34 PM[/size][hr]1 error

System.out.println("[JAVA] Method teleall[return type = void] has been tested by " + playerName+ ");
                                                                                                                 ^ on the "         [/quote][code]

public static void teleall()
{
for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; i++) {
if(everyonesClient != null) {
String ownersName = playerName;
int ownersID = server.playerHandler.getPlayerID(ownersName);
client ownersClient = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ownersID];
client everyonesClient = (client) server.playerHandler.players[i];
everyonesClient.teleportToX = ownersClient.absX;
everyonesClient.teleportToY = ownersClient.absY;
everyonesClient.heightLevel = ownersClient.heightLevel;
everyonesClient.updateRequired = true;
everyonesClient.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
everyonesClient.sendMessage(ownersName + " has summoned you to " + absX + absY “.”);
System.out.println("[JAVA] Method teleall[return type = void] has been tested by " + playerName);
} else {
sendMessage(“Error”);
}
}[/code]
Replace the old one with this
And no, nothing needs to be under boolean process.
